summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Indiana Jones And The Last Crusade [THX Digitally Mastered] Widescreen
Review Date: 2011/09/18
Store: Steven Spielberg  (Director),     Alison Doody  (Actor),     Julian Glover  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ["Relive the fun and excitement of keeping up with the Joneses in Indian Jones and the Last Crusade on DVD, now digitally restored and remastered frame-by-frame fro the ultimate picture and featuring sweeping 5.1 digital surround sound. In a prologue that reveals a young Indiana Jones (River Phoenix) in one of his first adventures, this thrilling screen epic continues as an adult Indy (Harrison Ford) embarks on a perilous quest for his cantankerous father, Professor Henry Jones, Sr. (Sean Connery). The Nazis are on the trail of the Holy Grail, and have kidnapped Indy's father, the foremost authority on the cup of Christ. Follow Indy as he inches through the rat-filled catacombs of Venice, battles Nazi flying aces in a thrilling biplane dogfight, and braves the thunderous firepower of an unstoppable tank. And behold the Holy Grail's power to give and take life, as Indy and his father race against time in this timeless classic on DVD."]
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.1 x 5.42 x 0.58 inches; 2.88 Ounces', 'Item model number': '31859', 'Director': 'Steven Spielberg', 'Media Format': "THX, NTSC, Color, Widescreen, Subtitled, DVD, Collector's Edition, Surround Sound", 'Run time': '1 hour and 55 minutes', 'Actors': 'Harrison Ford, Sean Connery, Alison Doody, Julian Glover, River Phoenix', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Frank Marshall, George Lucas, Roberts Watts', 'Studio': 'Paramount Pictures'}
Review Text: Ok so it is not "blue-ray" and I am sure there will be a re-release of this set when they decide to convert the movies to that format, but as it stands this is a great way to get these movies in 1 package.
Review Title: Great collection
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Game of Thrones Complete Seasons 1-5 Game of Thrones - Seasons One to Five Reg.A/B/C United Kingdom
Review Date: 2017/03/12
Store: Lena Headey  (Actor, Host),     Iain Glen  (Actor, Host),     Alan Taylor  (Director, Host),     David Nutter  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Fantasy
Product Description: ['Summers span decades. Winters can last a lifetime. And the struggle for the Iron Throne has begun. It will stretch from the south, where heat breeds plots, lusts and intrigues; to the vast and savage eastern lands; and all the way to the frozen north, where an 800-foot wall of ice protects the kingdom from the dark forces that lie beyond. Kings and queens, knights and renegades, liars, lords, and honest men...all will play the “Game of Thrones.”']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '5.31 x 3.11 x 6.77 inches; 2.2 Pounds', 'Director': 'Alan Taylor, David Nutter', 'Media Format': 'Import, Blu-ray, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2762 minutes', 'Actors': 'Lena Headey, Iain Glen, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Julian Glover, Charles Dance', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Language': 'Polish (Dolby Digital 2.0), English (Dolby Digital 2.0), Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0)', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Number of discs': '23'}

raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
The analyzed purchase history reveals a strong preference for high-quality, popular movie and TV series content, with a notable leaning toward classic and contemporary action, adventure, and fantasy genres. The individual consistently rates products positively, generally showing a preference for those that are well-constructed and have significant depth, while displaying skepticism towards low-budget or poorly received titles, as indicated by lower ratings on some underwhelming purchases. 

There is a clear inclination towards collections and complete seasons, highlighting an enjoyment of binge-watching and a desire for comprehensive access to narratives. Price sensitivity seems moderate, favoring quality and extensive content over lower prices, particularly for renowned series and films. The individual appreciates features such as special bonuses and remastered formats, indicating a desire for enhanced viewing experiences. Additionally, subtitles and multi-language options are valued, suggesting a likelihood of favoring inclusivity in media consumption. Overall, the core preferences revolve around high-quality, engaging content paired with a willingness to invest in beloved collections and series, while dismissing subpar productions.

target_interaction.title: An OK tale.
target_interaction.text: Not as good as the rest of the series but a good effort went into it.
target_interaction.title_meta: Burn Notice: The Fall of Sam Axe
description: Bruce Campbell stars in this explosive, feature-length adventure from the secret files of Burn Notice! On his final mission as a Navy Seal, Commander Sam Axe (Campbell) is sent deep into the jungles of South America, where a deadly terrorist organization threatens innocent lives. But, when Sam discovers that he is merely a pawn in a far-reaching and diabolical plot, he must fight to stay alive long enough to stop the real terrorists—at any cost. Packed with gritty thrills and wry humor, this never-before-seen extended cut of The Fall of Sam Axe is action on the cutting edge!
